issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.77 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #4caf50, font size: 9.0pt (12px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.78:1. Recommendation:  change background to #258829.
issues.description: Download

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.78:1. Recommendation:  change background to #258829.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div:nth-child(6) > div:nth-child(1) > ul:nth-child(4) > li:nth-child(2) > a

issues.title: <html> element must have a lang attribute

any.message: The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.
issues.description:
<html><head>
<title>LibriVox</title>
...</html>

original_issue.message: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.26:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #0066cc, surrounding text: #333333)
The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.26:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #0066cc, surrounding text: #333333)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="text" placeholder="Search by Author, Title or Reader">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.context: <input type="text" placeholder="Search by Author, Title or Reader">

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description: <input type="text" placeholder="Search by Author, Title or Reader">

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.context: <input type="text" placeholder="Search by Author, Title or Reader">
